FLOATING SLAB

JUSTIN MCKEEN
DRAWING TITLE:
NOTES, PLAN & SECTION(S)

25-01-084
pages.general_notes_verbatim:
GENERAL NOTES:
FOUNDATIONS:
1. REMOVE ALL TOPSOIL AND ORGANIC MATERIAL FROM THE BUILDING AREA.
2. SLAB MUST BE CARRIED DOWN TO NATURAL UNDISTURBED SOIL CAPABLE OF SUSTAINING 1500 PSF (75 kPa) PRESSURE UNDER THE BASE OF FOOTINGS OR 1500 PSF (75 kPa) UNDER STRUCTURAL SLAB, WHICHEVER GOVERNS.
3. IF FILL IS TO BE BUILT UP, GRANULAR 'B' IS TO BE USED. A GEOTECHNICAL ENGINEER MUST INSPECT FILL & COMPACTION TO BE APPROVED BY GEOTECHNICAL ENGINEER.
4. ENGINEERING BUILDING ON FOUNDATIONS PROVIDING SATISFACTORY FOUNDATION DRAINAGE SYSTEM.
5. FOUNDATION INSULATION: IF NOT INSTALLED, CLIENT CONTRACTOR ACCEPTS THE POTENTIAL OF CRACKING/HEAVING OVER TIME IF BUILDING IS NOT HEATED (NO HEAT LOSS OF BUILDING BE HEATED).
6. IF FOUNDATION INSULATION IS NOT INSTALLED, CLIENT CONTRACTOR ACCEPTS THE POTENTIAL OF CRACKING/HEAVING OVER TIME.
7. ALL INSULATION, BACKFILL, VENEER MAY BE USED TO MAXIMUM OF ABOVE SLAB.
8. CLIENT INSTRUCTED TO CONFIRM SLAB DIMENSIONS BEFORE ORDERING MATERIAL & STARTING CONSTRUCTION.
CONCRETE:
1. ALL CONCRETE ON THIS PROJECT SHALL HAVE A MINIMUM OF 20 DAY COMPRESSIVE STRENGTH OF 32 MPa WITH 6-8% AIR ENTRAINMENT AND A MAX WATER-TO-CEMENT RATIO OF 0.45.
2. REINFORCEMENT SHALL BE GRADE 400W.
3. WELDED WIRE MESH SHALL BE 152 x 152 MW18.7/MW18.7.
4. REBAR SPACING SHALL BE 1' LAP.
5. ALL CONCRETE WORK SHALL BE CARRIED OUT IN ACCORDANCE TO THE LATEST EDITION OF THE ONTARIO BUILDING CODE, CAN/CSA-A23.1-00 AND LOCAL BY-LAWS.
6. SLAB ON GRADE SHALL BE 100mm (4") THICK.
   a) WHERE CONCRETE IS IN CONTACT WITH EARTH (I.E. FOOTINGS).
   b) WHERE CONCRETE IS IN CONTACT WITH EARTH (I.E. SIDE OF THE FLOATING SLAB).
7. SLAB ON GRADE SHALL BE 100mm (4") GRANULAR 'A' FILL COMPACTED TO 95% SPD.
8. SLOPE CONCRETE AWAY FROM BUILDING.
9. SLAB SHALL BE SAW CUT TO A DEPTH OF SLAB THICKNESS (1/2"). SPACE SAW CUTS @ 15' o.c.
10. SLAB IS TO BE POURED MONOLITHICALLY.
11. SET UP JOINTS RECOMMENDED FOR ALL UTILITY CONNECTIONS.
REVIEW OF FLOATING SLABS:
IF REVIEW OF EDGE OR END OF FLOATING SLAB...
pages.page_overview_summary: This sheet provides a detailed plan and sections for a floating slab foundation, including thickened edges and thermal breaks. The general notes cover foundational requirements, concrete specifications, and construction guidelines. The plan view shows dimensions of the slab, while sections illustrate specific construction details such as rebar placement and insulation. The drawing is intended for a foundation level and includes critical notes for ensuring structural integrity and compliance with building codes.
